GSM: Good coverage indoors on 850/900 MHz. Repeaters possible. 35 km hard limit.
UMTS (3GSM): Smaller cells and lower indoors coverage on 2100 MHz; equivalent coverage indoors and superior range to GSM on 850/900 MHz.
IS-95 (CDMA one): Unlimited cell size, low transmitter power permits large cells
IS-2000 (CDMA 2000): Unlimited cell size, low transmitter power permits large cells

GSM: 0.2 MHz = 8 timeslots. Each timeslot can hold up to 2 calls (4 calls with VAMOS) through interleaving.
UMTS (3GSM): 5 MHz = 2 Mbit/s. 42Mbit/s for HSPA+. Each call uses 1.8-12 kbit/s depending on chosen quality and audio complexity.
